title: Morgan Stanley Sees Plenty of Lift in Airline Stocks
text: The COVID-19 pandemic delivered a severe blow to the airline industry. At the low point last May, airline stocks were down between 50% and 80%.

title: Some airline stocks are back at pre-pandemic levels but earnings are not: Analyst
text: Helane Becker, Cowen senior research analyst, and Kari Firestone, chairman and CEO of Aureus Asset Management, joined "Squawk Box" on Tuesday to discuss the strength of a possible reopening trade.

title: Major Airlines' Booking Services Crash Due To Google Software Issue
text: The issue has prevented customers from reserving flights at American Airlines, Delta Airlines and United Airlines.

title: Several airlines' booking sites down due to Google software issue
text: Google said it was working on a fix for the issue

title: CDC's New Guidance Makes the Skyline Sunnier for U.S. Airlines
text: CDC's latest travel manual provides a further impetus to the U.S. airline stocks like Delta (DAL), Southwest Airlines (LUV) and American Airlines (AA), which are scaling an outstanding graph on the bourses this year.
